FLASH: A device that produces a short _____ of light to help illuminate a scene, mostly for night-time or indoors photography.
INSTANT: A very short period of time; a moment.
JIFFY: A very short, unspecified length of time.
MINUTE: A unit of time equal to sixty seconds (one-sixtieth of an hour).
MOMENT: A brief, unspecified amount of time.
SECOND: Something that is number two in a series.
TICK: A tiny woodland arachnid of the suborder Ixodida.
